get.description: Returns detailed information about a single liquidity pool by address and chain id

parameters.name: poolAddress
parameters.description:
The address of the pool:
* **Standard Format:** A 42 character Ethereum contract address.
* **V4 Format:** A bytes32 Pool ID hex string

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: The chain id of the pool. This must be a supported network chain id.

200.description: The pool data was successfully retrieved.

error.title: Invalid Parameters
error.message: The provided liquidity pool address is not valid
error.details: A liquidity pool address must either be a valid ethereum address (20-byte) or a v4 pool id (32-byte)

error.title: Invalid Parameters
error.details: The provided ID is not supported. Supported IDs are: [1, 143, 130, 999, 8453, 9745, 534352].

error.title: Not Found
error.message: Couldn't find the specified liquidity pool at the specified chain
error.details: No liquidity pool exists for the given address and chain. Verify the liquidity pool address and chain ID are correct

get.summary: Get information about a single liquidity pool

post.description: Find liquidity pools across multiple chains and protocols with advanced filtering and sorting.

200.description: Successfully retrieved a list of matching liquidity pools.

error.title: Invalid Parameters
error.details: Check the 'meta' field for specific field-level violations.

get.description:
### Overview
Returns a comprehensive list of all protocols supported by the API across all blockchains.

### Response Data
Each protocol includes but is not limited to:
* **ID:** The unique kebab-case identifier used in filters.
* **Name:** The human-readable brand name.

200.description: List of supported protocols retrieved successfully.

get.description: Returns all token baskets (e.g., Stablecoins, LSTs). Use the `chainIds` query parameter to filter to specific networks; if omitted, defaults to all supported networks.

parameters.name: chainIds
parameters.description: Filter results to specific networks by chain ID. Comma-separated list. If omitted, defaults to all supported networks.

200.description: The list of available token baskets.

get.summary: Get all token baskets across multiple networks.

get.description: Returns aggregated basket data for a specific basket ID (e.g., "usd-stablecoins"). Use the `chainIds` query parameter to filter to specific networks; if omitted, defaults to all supported networks.

parameters.name: basketId
parameters.description: The unique slug of the basket.

parameters.name: chainIds
parameters.description: Filter results to specific networks by chain ID. Comma-separated list. If omitted, defaults to all supported networks.

error.title: Invalid Parameters
error.details: The provided ID is not supported. Supported IDs are: usd-stablecoins, eth-pegged-tokens, btc-pegged-tokens, hype-pegged-tokens, monad-pegged-tokens, xau-stablecoins, eur-stablecoins

404.description: Token basket not found on the specified networks.

error.title: Not Found
error.message: Couldn't find the token basket 'usd-stablecoins' on any supported network
error.details: The requested token basket does not exist or has no assets on the specified network.

get.summary: Get a specific token basket by ID across multiple networks.

error.title: Invalid Parameters

404.description: Token basket not found in the specified network.

get.summary: Get a specific token basket for a specific network.

post.description:
Returns a list of tokens containing metadata for multiple blockchains in one single model.

### Key Capabilities:
- **Cross-Chain Discovery:** Instantly identify every network where a specific asset maintains a liquidity presence.
- **Metadata Consolidation:** Retrieve a single, high-fidelity model containing localized contract addresses and decimal precision for every supported chain.
- **Operational Efficiency:** Eliminate the need for manual network switching or multiple RPC calls to resolve cross-chain token identities.

200.description: The registry of multi-chain assets was successfully retrieved.

error.title: Invalid Parameters
error.message: limit must not be greater than 1000
error.details: Check the 'meta' field for specific field-level violations.

post.summary: Get a unified list of multi-chain assets

post.description: Searches for assets across all supported blockchains by keyword (name or symbol).

200.description: The search results were successfully retrieved.

400.description: Validation failed for search query or filtering parameters.

error.title: Invalid Parameters
error.details: Check the 'meta' field for specific field-level violations.

get.description:
Searches for a token at the specified contract address in all supported blockchain networks (or a subset via `chainIds`).

Returns a list of matching tokens with their metadata (Chain ID, Name, Symbol, Decimals). Does **not** include Pool TVL metrics.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The Token contract address to search for.

parameters.name: chainIds
parameters.description: Optional list of chain IDs to restrict the lookup to.

200.description: Tokens found at the specified address.

get.summary: Search for a token by address across multiple chains.

get.description: Retrieves comprehensive details about a token on a specific blockchain.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the blockchain where the token resides.

404.description: The requested token was not found on the specified chain.

error.title: Not Found
error.message: Couldn't find the specified token at the specified chain
error.details: Token with address '0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000001' at chain id '1' not found

info.title: hydric Gateway API
info.description: Access DeFi Liquidity easily. One plug. Every Protocol. Every Network.

bearerAuth.description: Use the docs sandbox API key for authentication: **hydric_docs_4N4ocuirsN8Sh**

latestSqrtPriceX96.description: The current square root price in Q64.96 format. Use this for high-precision swap math.

latestTick.description: The integer index representing the current price ($1.0001^{tick}$).

tickSpacing.description: The minimum granularity of price ranges (ticks) for this pool (e.g., 60 for 0.3% fee pools).

positionManagerAddress.description: The address of the NonfungiblePositionManager responsible for Minting/Burning LP NFTs.

V3LiquidityPoolMetadata.description: Technical state for Concentrated Liquidity (V3) pools, including tick-level precision and price encoding.

stateViewAddress.description: The periphery StateView contract used for off-chain state queries. May be null if the protocol uses a custom implementation of V4 Architecture. Like the Pancake Swap Infinity CL

poolManagerAddress.description: The core V4 Singleton contract address that manages all pool states.

tickSpacing.description: The minimum granularity of price ranges (ticks) for this pool (e.g., 60 for 0.3% fee pools).

latestTick.description: The integer index representing the current price ($1.0001^{tick}$).

permit2Address.description: The Permit2 contract used for token approvals and signature-based transfers for this pool.

latestSqrtPriceX96.description: The latest sqrtPriceX96 value. Represented as a string to preserve precision for BigInt calculations.

hook.description: Information about the hook of the v4 liquidity pool if it exists. In case that this pool has no hooks attached, this field will be null

positionManagerAddress.description: The contract used to manage positions for v4 liquidity pools

V4LiquidityPoolMetadata.description: Architectural specifications and state for Uniswap V4 (Singleton) pools

address.description: The contract address of the Algebra plugin

config.description: Bitmask representing the enabled capabilities of the Algebra plugin. Each bit corresponds to a specific behavior defined by the Algebra protocol (e.g., dynamic fee logic).

AlgebraLiquidityPoolPlugin.description: Relevant information about the plugin of an algebra liquidity pool

latestSqrtPriceX96.description: The current square root price in Q64.96 format. Use this for high-precision swap math.

latestTick.description: The integer index representing the current price ($1.0001^{tick}$).

tickSpacing.description: The minimum granularity of price ranges (ticks) for this pool (e.g., 60 for 0.3% fee pools).

positionManagerAddress.description: The address of the NonfungiblePositionManager responsible for Minting/Burning LP NFTs.

deployer.description:
The address that initiated the pool deployment. 
  
  * **Standard Pools:** Returns the Zero Address (0x0...) for pools deployed via the default factory.
  * **Custom/Permissioned Pools:** Returns the specific address of the deployer for non-standard or private pool instances.

version.description: The specific version of the Algebra core/integral logic used by this pool instance.

communityFeePercentage.description: The protocol-level "cut" taken from the total swap fee represented in a percentage

plugin.description:
The plugin contract attached to this pool, including its address and configuration.
  
  Plugins in Algebra Integral are conceptually similar to Uniswap V4 Hooks and allow modular logic
  to be executed at specific lifecycle points (e.g., dynamic fee calculation, oracle updates,
  or custom volatility tracking).
  
  If the pool does not have a plugin configured, this field is 'null'.

AlgebraLiquidityPoolMetadata.description: Technical state and architectural configuration for Algebra Integral (Modular V3) pools

latestSqrtPriceX96.description: The current square root price in Q64.96 format. Use this for high-precision swap math.

latestTick.description: The integer index representing the current price ($1.0001^{tick}$).

tickSpacing.description: The minimum granularity of price ranges (ticks) for this pool (e.g., 60 for 0.3% fee pools).

positionManagerAddress.description: The address of the NonfungiblePositionManager responsible for Minting/Burning LP NFTs.

SlipstreamLiquidityPoolMetadata.description: Technical state and architectural configuration for Slipstream pools

SuccessResponse.description: Global Success Response that every endpoint returns if the request was successful (not errors).

chainId.description: The chain id of the network where the token resides.

address.description:
The contract address of the token on its host network.

* **ERC-20 Tokens:** The 20-byte hex contract address.
* **Native Assets (e.g., ETH, MATIC):** Represented by the "Zero Address" (`0x000...000`).

decimals.description: The number of decimal places used to represent the smallest fractional unit of the token (e.g., 18 for ETH, 6 for USDC).

name.description: The full human-readable name of the asset (e.g., "Ethereum", "Wrapped Bitcoin").

symbol.description: The ticker symbol of the token (e.g., "ETH", "WBTC")..

logoUrl.description: The URL of the token logo.

SingleChainTokenMetadata.description: Core identifying metadata for a token on a single blockchain.

amount.description: The human-readable token balance, adjusted for decimals (normalized).

amountUsd.description: The current market value of the token reserve inside the pool denominated in USD.

token.description: The metadata of the underlying blockchain token.

LiquidityPoolTokenBalance.description: A normalized representation of a specific token reserve inside a pool.

totalValueLockedUsd.description: The aggregate USD value of all assets held within the pool (Total Value Locked).

tokens.description: The detailed breakdown of individual token reserves and their USD-denominated values.

LiquidityPoolBalance.description: The aggregate financial state and tokens inventory of a liquidity pool.

id.description: The slug or unique string-based identifier for the protocol (e.g., "uniswap-v3").

name.description: The official commercial name of the protocol used for display purposes.

url.description: The primary landing page or official website for the protocol.

logoUrl.description: A canonical URL pointing to the protocol icon or brand logo (usually in SVG or high-res PNG format).

feeTierPercentage.description: The exact percentage of fee a trader pays when using this pool.

isDynamic.description: Whether the fee tier is dynamic. A dynamic fee tier means the fee can change according to protocol-defined rules or market conditions.

LiquidityPoolFeeTier.description: Information about how much fee a trader will pay to perform swaps in this pool.

swapVolumeUsd.description: The cumulative swap volume processed by the pool

feesUsd.description: Total revenue generated from swap fees and distributed to liquidity providers.

netInflowUsd.description: The net change in liquidity (deposits - withdrawals). Positive values indicate capital growth; negative values indicate capital flight.

liquidityVolumeUsd.description: The gross amount of liquidity activity (sum of all deposits and withdrawals).

yield.description: The annualized yield projected based on the performance observed.

LiquidityPoolStats.description: Relevant stats about a liquidity pool. Such as Swap Fees, Swap Volume, Yield, net inflow, etc...

LiquidityPoolWindowedStats.description: Multi-horizon performance metrics aggregated over the specified period

address.description:
The unique on-chain identifier for the pool. 
    - **Standard:** The contract address of the pool.
    - **V4 Singleton:** The unique 'poolId' (bytes32 hash) used by the Manager.

tokens.description: Deterministic list of assets in the pool. The array order strictly follows the protocol's internal "Token 0, 1... N" indexing.

balance.description: The aggregate inventory state, including Total Value Locked (TVL) and individual asset reserves.

protocol.description: The protocol that owns the liquidity pool and its metadata

createdAtTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) of the block where the pool was created.

chainId.description: The chain id where the liquidity pool is deployed. Following EIP-155 standards. Check out [Chainlist](https://chainlist.org) to discover the chain id of any EVM Blockchain

type.description: The architectural classification of the pool. This field acts as the discriminator for the polymorphic "metadata" object.

feeTier.description: Information about the fee tier of this Liquidity Pool

stats.description: Dynamic performance data including volume, fees, and yield aggregated over rolling time windows.

metadata.description: Deep architectural state (Ticks, Hooks, Plugins). The schema of this object is determined by the "type" field.

LiquidityPool.description:
The universal interface for liquidity pools. hydric normalizes diverse protocol architectures (V2, V3, V4, Algebra) into this single, high-fidelity model. 

### Integration Strategy:
1. **Core Fields:** Use for portfolio tracking, analytics, and global search.
2. **Metadata:** Use for protocol-specific execution, such as calculating ticks or interacting with V4 hooks.

GetSingleLiquidityPoolResponse.description: Response object for retrieving a single liquidity pool.

code.description: A hydric error code for programmatic handling.

message.description: A detailed explanation of the error.
message.example: The provided pool address does not match the expected format.

details.description: A more detailed explanation of the error. Containing also Technical hints or stuff that can help to debug the error.
details.example: Pool address should be 20 bytes long, with 42 characters, starting with 0x.

metadata.description: Dynamic context data useful for debugging or UI handling.

ErrorResponse.description: Default error response object that is returned when any error occurs.

pools.description: List of pools matching the search criteria.

filters.description: Filters that were applied to produce the result set.

nextCursor.description: Cursor for the next page. Null if no more results.

chainId.description: The chain id of the address. Must be one of the supported networks

address.description: The address tied to the blockchain

BlockchainAddress.description: An address that is tied to a blockchain

minimumTotalValueLockedUsd.description: The minimum total value locked (USD) for a pool to be included in the response.

blockedPoolTypes.description: Filter out specific liquidity pool types.

blockedProtocols.description: Filter out specific protocols by ID.

protocols.description:
**Allow-list of supported Protocol IDs.** **Stability Note:** While hydric normalizes core pool data, the `metadata` field contains protocol/type specific fields (e.g., hooks, plugins, addresses, pool math). If your integration logic depends on these specialized fields, we recommend explicitly defining your supported protocols. This prevents your application from receiving novel protocol structures before your custom logic is ready to parse their unique `metadata`.

If omitted, all protocols (excluding `blockedProtocols`) are included.

poolTypes.description:
**Allow-list of supported Liquidity Pool architectures.**

**Architecture Note:** Use this to restrict results to specific pool designs (V3, V4, etc.). While the top-level schema is unified, depending in your integration logic, you need to use the `metadata` field (e.g., allowing deposits), then you should explicitly define your supported architectures. Explicit filtering ensures your UI only attempts to interact with pool structures it is designed to handle.

If omitted, all architectures (excluding `blockedPoolTypes`) are included.

field.description: Field that you want to order pools by.

direction.description: Sorting direction of the selected field.

timeframe.description: Timeframe used when ordering by a stats-based field. Does not apply when ordering by total fields, like TVL.

limit.description: The number of items to return.

orderBy.description: Ordering configuration. Note: Changing this while using a cursor may yield inconsistent results.

cursor.description: Base64-encoded cursor for pagination. Fetch this from the "nextCursor" field of a previous response. Do not pass this if you want to start from the beginning.

tokensA.description:
Primary set of token addresses. The search engine returns pools containing at least one of these tokens.

- **Single Token Search:** Provide 'tokensA' and omit 'tokensB'.
- **Pair Search:** Used in conjunction with 'tokensB'.
- **Note:** Token ordering does not affect search results.

tokensB.description:
Secondary set of token identifiers used to narrow the search to specific pairs.

- **Relationship:** Returns pools containing (one token from 'tokensA') AND (one token from 'tokensB').
- **Broad Search:** If omitted, the search returns any pool containing a token from 'tokensA'.
- **Note:** Evaluation is order-independent.

filters.description: Filters based on pool attributes like TVL and protocol types.

config.description: Configuration for the search such as limit, cursor, etc.

GetProtocolsResponse.description: Response object for listing all supported protocols.

id.description: The unique identifier of the token basket.

name.description: The human-readable name of the basket.

description.description: A detailed description of what the basket represents.
description.example: A basket of the most liquid USD stablecoins in the ecosystem.

logoUrl.description: The URL of the basket logo.

chainIds.description: List of chain IDs where this basket is available.

addresses.description: List of underlying token addresses across supported chains.

tokens.description: Token metadata for the assets in this basket.

TokenBasket.description: Multiple tokens grouped together to represent a basket of assets for a specific primitive or theme.

example.name: USD Stablecoins
example.description: A basket of the most liquid USD stablecoins in the ecosystem.

example.name: USD Stablecoins
example.description: A basket of the most liquid USD stablecoins in the ecosystem.

field.description: Field that you want to order tokens by.

direction.description: Sorting direction of the selected field.

matchAllSymbols.description:
Toggles the inclusion of multiple assets sharing the exact same ticker symbol.

* **false (Default):** Returns only the single most liquid (highest TVL) instance per chain. This is the "Canonical View" used to filter out secondary deployments.
* **true:** Includes every asset on a chain that matches the symbol string exactly, provided they pass basic price and metadata parity checks.

> ###  Security Note
> When set to `true`, the probability of encountering **impersonation or scam tokens** increases. While hydric applies secondary heuristics (price,liquidity, etc.), enabling this flag bypasses the primary canonical filter. **Users assume all risks associated with verifying the authenticity of non-canonical contract addresses returned by this configuration.**

limit.description: The number of items to return in the response.

orderBy.description:
Ordering configuration for the result.

**Critical Notes:**
- **Sequence Integrity:** Do not expect a 100% perfect sequence. Because multi-chain data is computed on-the-fly, some tokens may appear slightly out of order. This is an approximation used to maintain high-speed responses.
- **Pagination Warning:** Changing the sorting parameters while using a cursor will break your pagination flow and return inconsistent results.

cursor.description: Base64-encoded cursor for pagination. Fetch this from the "nextCursor" field of a previous response. Do not pass this if you want to start from the beginning.

chainIds.description: Filter results to specific networks by chain ID. If omitted, defaults to all supported networks.

minimumTotalValuePooledUsd.description:
The minimum aggregate liquidity in USD for a token to be included in the response. 
This filters out low-liquidity assets across the indexed ecosystems.

minimumSwapsCount.description: The minimum cumulative swap count required for an asset to be included in the response.

minimumSwapVolumeUsd.description: The minimum cumulative **Swap Volume** (USD) since the asset was deployed.

config.description: Configuration for the token list request such as limit, order, cursor, etc.

filters.description: Filters for the token list request to personalize the response.

addresses.description: The collection of underlying contract addresses for this token across multiple chains.

symbol.description: The representative token symbol across all chains

name.description: The representative token name across all chains

logoUrl.description: The representative token logo across all chains

chainIds.description: The chain IDs where this token is available

MultiChainTokenMetadata.description: Simple metadata for a single token across multiple blockchain ecosystems. This aggregates fragmented chain-specific metadata into a unified model to simplify cross-chain interactions.

nextCursor.description: Cursor for the next page. Null if no more results.

chainIds.description: Filter results to specific networks by chain ID. If omitted, defaults to all supported networks.

minimumTotalValuePooledUsd.description: The minimum aggregate liquidity in USD for a token to be included in the search. Search uses 0 by default to show most results.

minimumSwapsCount.description: The minimum cumulative swap count for a token to be included in the search. Search uses 0 by default.

minimumSwapVolumeUsd.description: The minimum cumulative Swap Volume (USD) for a token to be included in the search. Search uses 0 by default.

search.description:
The search term to filter assets by ticker symbol or name.
- **Ticker Symbol or Name:** (e.g., 'ETH', 'USD', 'Wrapped')  Case-insensitive substring match.

filters.description: Additional filters to personalize the search results.

tokens.description: List of tokens found at this address across different chains.

The contract address of the token on its host network.

* **ERC-20 Tokens:** The 20-byte hex contract address.
* **Native Assets (e.g., ETH, MATIC):** Represented by the "Zero Address" (`0x000...000`).

decimals.description: The number of decimal places used to represent the smallest fractional unit of the token (e.g., 18 for ETH, 6 for USDC).

name.description: The full human-readable name of the asset (e.g., "Ethereum", "Wrapped Bitcoin").

symbol.description: The ticker symbol of the token (e.g., "ETH", "WBTC")..

logoUrl.description: The URL of the token logo.

totalValuePooledUsd.description: Represents the total USD value of this token currently locked in indexed liquidity pools.

SingleChainTokenInfo.description: Complete information about a token on a single blockchain, including pool metrics.

limit.description: The number of items to return in the response.

orderBy.description: Ordering configuration for the token list.

cursor.description: Base64-encoded cursor for pagination. Fetch this from the "nextCursor" field of a previous response. Do not pass this if you want to start from the beginning.

minimumTotalValuePooledUsd.description:
The minimum aggregate liquidity in USD for a token to be included in the response. 
This filters out low-liquidity assets across the indexed ecosystem.

minimumSwapsCount.description: The minimum cumulative swap count required for an asset to be included in the response.

minimumSwapVolumeUsd.description: The minimum cumulative **Swap Volume** (USD) since the asset was deployed, required for an asset to appear.

filters.description: Filters for the token list request to personalize the response.

tokens.description: List of tokens on the specified blockchain

nextCursor.description: Cursor for the next page. Null if no more results.

minimumTotalValuePooledUsd.description: The minimum aggregate liquidity in USD for a token to be included in the search. Search uses 0 by default to show most results.

minimumSwapsCount.description: The minimum cumulative swap count for a token to be included in the search. Search uses 0 by default.

minimumSwapVolumeUsd.description: The minimum cumulative Swap Volume (USD) for a token to be included in the search. Search uses 0 by default.

The search term to filter assets by ticker symbol or name.
- **Ticker Symbol or Name:** (e.g., 'ETH', 'USD', 'Wrapped')  Case-insensitive substring match.
